part_one: ^Li is sitting in the corner, her face barely visible behind a curtain of black hair. She doesn't move when you arrive. She doesn't say anything either.
^"Mortal! I am the muse Erato! Acknowledge me!"

c-0: ^She doesn't move, but you hear a muttered "hey" from the teenager. A few moments pass, and it seems the girl has nothing else to say.

^Thanks to the client paperwork, you already know that Li Ryan-Jiang is a sixteen-year-old Chinese Canadian from Toronto, but it seems worth hearing how she sees herself. But all you get is another lone syllable. "Li."
^"Okay. Why don't you tell me what brings you to Muse, Inc, Li?"

c-1: ^That gets the girl to look your way. Her expression reveals a skeptic rather than a supplicant. Classic teenager.
^"Are you for real?" she asks. "With the whole intimidation thing?"
^"It depends on whether you displease me, child!"
^"Nah, not really. But some people like the whole charade."

c-0: ^You didn't think it was possible, but Li curls even deeper into the corner.
^"Um," she stammers, "Look, I don't really need any divine help, it's not that big a deal, I'll just go."
^"It's fine. I'm just teasing. What brings you to Muse, Inc?"
c-1: ^"Huh." Li looks back to the floor. "Whatever."

part_two: ^Li finally stands up. She's petite even for a teenager, but she covers a lot of ground as she paces the room, nervous energy propelling her feet. After she makes two complete circuits, Li slouches back into her chair.
^"How about you just tell me about yourself first?"

g-0: ^She shrugs. "I dunno. Sure. I don't see how I'm that interesting to a goddess."
^"I wouldn't ask if I wasn't interested."

part_three: ^Again, the teenager only shrugs. Once more, her eyes turn floor-ward.

c-1: ^Li makes a noncommital noise, but gives no real answer.
c-2: ^She offers no response to your question.

part_four: ^"Isn't there anything you can tell me? Anything about yourself at all?"

c-0: ^She seems to be thinking about whether or not to venture a tidbit about herself.

c-1: ^"I like the color red. Especially the one made from cinnabar. You know. Vermilion.

g-0: ^Li swings her feet up and crosses her legs on the chair. "Cool."
^This has been one of the most confusing attempts to inspire you've ever had.
^"Well. Why don't you hang out here for a bit?"
g-1: ^"Are you coming back?" the girl asks. "What should I do?"
^"I'll come back. And don't worry, you'll think of something."
